metadata.Title: CVE-2019-10081 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description: HTTP/2 (2.4.20 through 2.4.39) very early pushes, for example configured with "H2PushResource", could lead to an overwrite of memory in the pushing request's pool, leading to crashes. The memory copied is that of the configured push link header values, not data supplied by the client.

notes.Note: sbeattie> apache 2.4.20 and newer apache 2.4.18 does not build mod_http2.

criterions.comment: apache2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
